alert.note: Alert for Dripping Springs; Globe, Miami; Mazatzal Mountains; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County; Tonto Basin (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 9:46AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall will be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Arizona, including the following areas, Dripping Springs, Globe/Miami, Mazatzal Mountains, Pinal/Superstition Mountains, Rio Verde/Salt River, San Carlos, Southeast Gila County and Tonto Basin. * WHEN...From 1 PM MST this afternoon through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Low-water crossings may be flooded. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A band of strong showers and thunderstorms are expected to develop this afternoon and evening over the higher terrain areas of Gila and eastern Maricopa Counties. High rain rates may lead to excessive runoff and flash flooding, especially over burn scar areas where they are more prone to rapid runoff. The recent Diamond as well as the Bush, Telegraph, and Mescal burn scars will be the burn scars most susceptible to flash flooding in the area. Rain rates on average of 1-2 inches with locally higher at times per hour are expected throughout this afternoon and evening. While storm motions may be quick, training of showers and storms over terrain features will heighten flash flood potential. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Dripping Springs; Globe, Miami; Mazatzal Mountains; Pinal, Superstition Mountains; Rio Verde, Salt River; San Carlos; Southeast Gila County; Tonto Basin
